poem:
Title: "A Politician's Season"

In the politics of seasons, Humza fell like autumn,
his failure to bud a dance with short-lived green,
Spring of Swinney's rise emerges from the shadows,
upon a stage still cooling from yesterday's duel.
This is not war, yet battles are fought, 
and in the end, it is always the fickle wind that decides.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "John Swinney favourite to become Scotland’s first minister after Humza Yousaf quits Humza Yousaf has stepped down as Scotland’s first minister after failing to secure enough cross-party support to survive a major crisis with the Scottish Greens. His resignation on Monday has thrown the Scottish National party into crisis, a little over a year after he took office, with the party’s former leader John Swinney quickly emerging as the favourite to become Scotland’s next first". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: John Swinney favourite to become Scotland’s first minister after Humza Yousaf quits Humza Yousaf has stepped down as Scotland’s first minister after failing to secure enough cross-party support to survive a major crisis with the Scottish Greens. His resignation on Monday has thrown the Scottish National party into crisis, a little over a year after he took office, with the party’s former leader John Swinney quickly emerging as the favourite to become Scotland’s next first
